author: alon.ssv.network
content:
Yesterday was a really great teaching moment and a great simulator for mainnet launch for everyone involved (implementation teams, staking services, infra and so on).
I know we at blox would love 1-2 more opportunities to test that first phase of activation.

If we can have a few resets as part of the multi client testnet that could be really great.

author: alon.ssv.network
content: <@!311971895828283393> <@!399309815517544451> idk if that's a ludicrous idea, would love your input.

author: ryg9705
content: If you look at the participation chart you can see when people go to bed at 23:00. Many people probably don't have a dedicated machine for staking and turn their PC off. On the testnet they don't need to run a dedicated node because there is nothing at stake at the moment. I would expect mainnet participation and finalization to be generally better simply because there is actually something at stake which is the whole point of Proof of Stake.

author: ryg9705
content: Of course nodes are spread all over the world but there is a high concentration in Europe and the US.

author: ryg9705
content: I would attribute the low initial participation to last minute updates to clients to get the bootnodes going. You could see on eth2stats that many nodes were sitting at 0 peers and prysm is currently run by the majority of people. This can be solved by having a longer genesis_delay.

author: arnetheduck
content: regarding attestations, one thing we're consistently seeing is very old attestations travelling in the network, ie right on the cusp where they should not be included

author: arnetheduck
content: if anyone else is seeing this, ping us please - it could also be a buildup in a queue, we're investigating

author: prestonvanloon
content: We are aware of 3 high priority fixes that are ready. We're preparing a new release off our normal schedule and it should be available within the next hour.
